I’d like to work on the #11375 issue. My approach:

Assign a unique key prop to each <li> element.

Ensure proper DOM hierarchy by preventing <li> nesting inside another <li>.

I can complete this by EOD. Could you please assign me this issue?

Best regards,
Gurdeep Singh

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11437
activity.text:
Hi @rithviknishad, @Jacobjeevan, @nihal467,

I would like to work on this issue. Here’s my proposed solution:

Proposed Solution:
Adjust CSS styles – Ensure that the text inside the cards is wrapped properly using word-wrap: break-word; and text-overflow: ellipsis where necessary.
Responsive Design Fixes – Implement proper flex/grid adjustments and media queries to optimize card layout for tablet screens.
Testing & Verification – Test across multiple screen sizes (both portrait and landscape tablet views) to confirm the fix works as expected.
Expected Timeline:
I can submit a pull request by March 21 or earlier.

Please assign me this task if everything looks good. Looking forward to contributing!

Best,
Gurdeep Singh

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11437
activity.text: Adjust patients and facilities cards responsiveness

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11307
activity.text:
Hi @Jacobjeevan , I would like to work on this issue and request you to assign it to me. My proposed approach is to initially fetch and display the full list of patients in the Facilities → Patients section. The existing search functionality will remain intact, allowing users to filter the list dynamically as they type.

To optimize performance, I plan to implement pagination or lazy loading if the patient list is large. Please let me know if you have any suggestions or if there's a preferred approach to follow. Looking forward to your guidance!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11307
activity.text: Enhancement: Display Full Patient List in Facilities → Patients Section

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11272
activity.text:
Comment on Issue #11272 – Adjust Organization Users Cards for Tablet

Hi @rithviknishad, @Jacobjeevan,

I would like to work on this issue. Here’s my proposed solution:

Proposed Solution:
Adjust CSS styles – Ensure that the text inside the user cards is wrapped properly using word-wrap: break-word;, overflow: hidden;, and text-overflow: ellipsis where necessary.
Responsive Design Fixes – Implement proper flex/grid adjustments and media queries to optimize card layout for tablet screens.
Testing & Verification – Test across multiple screen sizes (both portrait and landscape tablet views) to confirm the fix works as expected.
Expected Timeline:
I can submit a pull request by March 14th or earlier.

Please assign me this task if everything looks good. Looking forward to contributing!

Best,
Gurdeep Singh
